meanings.def: a small piece of paper with a design on it that you buy and stick on an envelope or a package before you post it
examples: a 67p stamp
Could I have three first-class stamps, please?
He has been collecting stamps since he was eight.
a stamp album
The Post Office has issued a commemorative stamp to mark the event.
Don't forget to put a stamp on.
She stuck a first-class stamp on the letter.
The Post Office has launched some new Christmas stamps.
The stamps were issued in 1863.
a book of ten first-class stamps

meanings.def: a tool for printing the date or a design or mark onto a surface
examples: a date stamp

meanings.def: a design or words made by stamping something onto a surface
examples: The passports, with the visa stamps, were waiting at the embassy.
(figurative) The project has the government's stamp of approval.

meanings.def: a small piece of paper with a design on it, stuck on a document to show that a particular amount of money has been paid
examples: a TV licence stamp

meanings.def: the mark or sign of a particular quality or person
examples: All his work bears the stamp of authority.
President Reagan left an indelible stamp on the nation.
She left her stamp on the school.
His work bears the unmistakable stamp of genius.
He has a new chance to put his stamp on policy.

meanings.def: a kind or class, especially of people
examples: men of a different stamp

meanings.def: an act or sound of stamping the foot
examples: The stamp of hoofs alerted Isabel.

meanings.def: to put your foot down heavily and noisily on the ground
examples: I tried stamping my feet to keep warm.
Sam stamped his foot in anger.
He stamped the snow off his boots.
The audience were stamping and cheering.
She stamped her foot impatiently.

meanings.def: to walk with loud heavy steps
examples: She turned and stamped out of the room.
The children came stamping down the stairs.
We watched our mother stamp away down the drive.
Lizzie turned and stamped noisily out of the room.
He stamped from the room.
He stamped off in disgust.

meanings.def: to print letters, words, a design, etc. onto something using a special tool
examples: stamp A (with B) The box was stamped with the maker's name.
Wait here to have your passport stamped.
stamp B on A I'll stamp the company name on your cheque.
The maker's name was stamped in gold on the box.
Approved goods were stamped with a hallmark.
(figurative) This is an album with ‘epic’ stamped all over it.

meanings.def: to make a feeling show clearly on somebody’s face, in their actions, etc.
examples: stamp A with B Their faces were stamped with hostility.
stamp B over, across, etc. A The crime had revenge stamped all over it.
Terror was stamped across her face.

meanings.def: to show that somebody has a particular quality
examples: Her success has stamped her as one of the country's top riders.

meanings.def: to stick a stamp on a letter or package
to cut and shape an object from a piece of metal or plastic using a special machine or tool
examples: The hinges are stamped out of sheets of metal.
